stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on two parallel tasks: (1) finishing Course 12’s Wild-West town (hat shop, bulletin board, mine-cart chase, upcoming Monty-Mole bank mission) and (2) stress-testing a brand-new collision/step system he rewrote the night before. Design discussions covered visual gags (cowboy hats on buildings, wanted posters), mission flow, and how to hide a secret tunnel behind a breakable boulder. Technical chatter included render-mode fixes, automatic text-box sizing, and performance of the new physics.

development_findings.summary: Kaze rewrote Mario’s collision/step logic from scratch using ray-casts plus a binary search for the largest viable step; it runs faster than the original and removes most clipping bugs but still mis-handles ceilings and causes occasional crashes.
development_findings.quote: I had an idea yesterday to just rewrite Mario's collision entirely. What you're seeing right now is the rewritten collision… once my new collision system is done, this game will be so nice collision-wise.

development_findings.summary: Spin-jump animation replaced with Mario’s Down-B from Smash Melee; Zeina created the base animation, Kaze polished it.
development_findings.quote: The closest you have to an official version of the spin jump from 1996 is Mario's Down-B from Smash Melee, so I went with that one. Zeina made the animation and I just polished it up a little bit.

development_findings.summary: Bulletin-board asset built as layered decals; Kaze fixed render-mode issues (environment vs opaque) and converted textures to fog-shaded decals.

Mine-cart mission is functionally complete: secret bar door → Shy-Guy cart chase with escalating difficulty; player fades out if too far or can be run over if jumping in front. Current crashes stem from unfinished collision code.
development_findings.quote: Imagine this, but without the crash. The crash is because of my new collision functions.

development_findings.summary: Design for Monty Mole ‘bank robbery’ mission: Koopa bank clerk NPC explains robbery; player follows particle trail to a tunnel hidden by a breakable boulder (will probably require Bomb Cap or ground-pound). Immediate boss fight planned after tunnel.
Auto-sizing dialogue boxes implemented; text window now scales to fit any string, easing future localization.
development_findings.quote: If I talk to him the text box is small now… it will automatically find the right size to encapsulate the text. Biobak, you're gonna like this a lot.

development_findings.summary: Yoshi coins replace 100-coin stars; no 100-coin missions will exist.
development_findings.quote: You don't have to do 100 coins. There are no 100 coins in this.

development_findings.summary: Considering course-order shuffle: move Wild West level to Course 13 and insert another course earlier to balance ‘Mario-centric’ vs ‘natural’ stages.
Overall scope: ~50 courses, 180 stars; internal tester took ~50 minutes on a single mid-game course, suggesting a 10–12 hour campaign.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design philosophy: original SM64 movement is great but level layouts lack ‘place-ness’; he mixes narrative stages with purely platforming ones so worlds feel like places Mario visits, not levels built for him.
context_findings.quote: A lot of them just exist and they don't really feel like anything. I want levels to have a theme, a vibe.

context_findings.summary: Lives in a cold North-American basement; frequent complaints about loud heater and being ‘snowed in’.
Personal health context: currently 213 lbs, cutting to 205; finds weight loss easy; rarely drinks alcohol.
Humorous worry about Nintendo DMCA—shows himself ‘wanted for DMCA violation’ on in-game poster.
Jokes about using idle N64 CPU time to mine Bitcoin, reflecting his optimisation focus and playful attitude.

biobak.summary: Produces multiple assets and will likely handle localisation; Kaze highlighted the new auto-text-box feature as something Biobak will appreciate.

zeina.summary: Created initial spin-jump animation; supplies textures and models (e.g., bulletin board, Koopa bank clerk, potential cane).
Collaborates in real time—Kaze asks her for missing texture bundles and critiques asset colour/brightness.

key_stories.title: Overnight Collision Rewrite
key_stories.summary: Kaze decided to scrap the decades-old SM64 collision code and implemented a new ray-cast + binary-search step system in a single night. Stream shows early tests: improved wall handling but ceiling bugs and crashes.
key_stories.challenge: Original collision allowed clipping and was slow; previous ray-cast experiment caused other issues.
key_stories.process: Replaced step logic with ray-casts to find maximum safe movement, added floor/space verification, still tuning ceiling checks.
key_stories.outcome: Substantially faster and smoother, positioned as ‘best collision in any SM64 hack’ once bugs are fixed.
key_stories.key_quote: I had an idea yesterday to just rewrite Mario's collision entirely.

key_stories.title: Mine-Cart Mission Meets New Physics
key_stories.summary: A fully scripted mine-cart chase in the Wild-West bar was ready, but the freshly rewritten physics made the game crash mid-demo.
key_stories.challenge: Integrate new collision with scripted set-piece without breaking.
key_stories.process: Secret bar door triggers chase; Shy Guys approach, player dodges; testing revealed crash.
key_stories.outcome: Mission design validated; stability fix deferred until collision rewrite finished.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine this, but without the crash. The crash is because of my new collision functions.

key_stories.title: Designing the Old-Man Koopa Banker
key_stories.summary: Need for a Wild-West bank NPC led to live concept art: beard, glasses, black shell, larger red nose. Zeina iterated textures while chat suggested Wild-West tropes.
key_stories.challenge: Generic Koopa model looked too plain for a banker.
key_stories.process: Brainstorming reference images, adding beard alpha texture, 3-D spectacles, colour tweaks, potential cane prop.
key_stories.outcome: Distinct ‘elder banker’ Koopa ready for Monty Mole mission dialogue.
key_stories.key_quote: He kind of looks like a bank guy… yeah, I think this works.
